messageBody:
2009/1/27 jaypeesmailbox <jaypeesmailbox@...>:
> Can any body help me on running Junit testcases from Quality centre.

Hi Jaypee.

On a recent project we had to integrate our JUnit tests with Quality
Centre. Instead of running the JUnit tests from QC, we ran them on the
build server and used a test listener to submit the test results to
quality centre.

We annotated tests that were recorded in QC with our own annotation, like this:

@Test @QualityCentre(id=12345)
public void someTestThatTheQAStaffCaredAbout() {
...
}

The test listener looked for that annotation when a test succeeded or
failed. If it found it on the test method it knew that the test was
also recorded in QC, and so submitted the result.

I can't remember how we submitted the result. QC might have a remote
API (check the documentation) or maybe we just wrote the results
directly into its database (nasty hack, but without an API what can
you do?).

--Nat
